statistics.name: freeThrows

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Old Dominion 81, Charlotte 48
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. -- Gerald Lee scored 16 points to lead four Old Dominion players in double figures as the Monarchs routed Charlotte 81-48 on Wednesday night. Lee was 8-for-10 from the floor, while Trian Iliadis added 13 points, Kent Bazemore had 11 and Frank Hassell 10. Old Dominion (8-4), which ranks second nationally in scoring defense, took a 30-10 lead en route to a 40-13 halftime margin. The 49ers shot 16 percent from the floor in the first half (4-for-25) to the Monarch's 58.1 percent (18-for-31). Charlotte (9-2) improved to 48.3 percent (14-for-29) in the second half, but could get no closer than 25 points and trailed by as many as 37. The Monarchs outrebounded the 49ers 47-26 and had 24 assists. Shamari Spears, Charlotte's leading scorer at 17.9 points per game, had 12 points while DiJuan Harris, who had been averaging 10.6 points per game, scored one point.
